example.text: Alpha-chain cDNA in COS-1 cells could have been significantly mutated by transient expression of the exon 8 resulted in deficiency of enzymatic activity.

Analyses of transcription in vivo of agn-lacZ with Dam target sequences that were mutated support this conclusion.

Cotransfections with plasmids expressing WT-1, WTAR (a mutated form of WT-1), p53, and a mutated form of p53 revealed a complex pattern of regulation with a 3-fold induction with WT-1, a 7-fold induction with p53 that has the ability to be mutated, and a 4-fold repression with wild-type p53.

Cotransfections with plasmids expressing WT-1, WTAR (a mutated form of WT-1), p53, and a mutated form of p53 revealed a complex pattern of regulation with a 3-fold induction with WT-1, a 7-fold induction with p53 that might have been mutated, and a 4-fold repression with wild-type p53.

Cotransfections with plasmids expressing WT-1, WTAR (a mutated form of WT-1), p53, and a mutated form of p53 revealed a complex pattern of regulation with a 3-fold induction with WT-1, a 7-fold induction with p53 which can be mutated, and a 4-fold repression with wild-type p53.

Cotransfections with plasmids expressing WT-1, WTAR (a mutated form of WT-1), p53, and a mutated form of p53 revealed a complex pattern of regulation with a 3-fold induction with WT-1, a 7-fold induction with p53 which has the ability to be mutated, and a 4-fold repression with wild-type p53.

For example, mutating the C-terminal MAP kinase sites (T235 and T239) essentially leads to abolished EGF-stimulated increase in phosphorylation and prevented EGF-induced mobility shift (Figure 5C, lanes 7 and 8).
example.arg: the C-terminal MAP kinase sites (T235 and T239)
abolished EGF-stimulated increase in phosphorylation and prevented EGF-induced mobility shift

example.text: In COS-7 cells cotransfected with PKA-Calpha and SOX9 expression plasmids, PKA enhanced the phosphorylation of wild-type SOX9 but did not affect phosphorylation of a SOX9 protein in which the two PKA phosphorylation sites (S (64) and S (211)) could have been mutated.

example.arg: the C-terminal MAP kinase sites (T235 and T239)

RCA is comprised of two major steps: (i) identifying pairs of residue positions which might mutate in a coordinated manner, and (ii) using these results to identify protein regions which interact with an uncommonly high number of other residues.
The DNA-binding mutant(Stat5aEE-AA) of Stat5a has been generated by mutating amino acids EE(437 and 438) to AA.

To determine how activators interact with the complex and to examine the importance of these interactions, relative to other potential targeting mechanisms, for SWI/SNF function, we identified and mutated Dam target sequences.

We have identified Leu40, Ile70, Val73, Leu75, and Pro77 on the ALK4 extracellular domain (Leu40, Ile70, Val73, Leu75, and Pro77) that, when being significantly mutated to alanine, have substantial effects on ALK4-trunc dominant negative activity.
example.arg: Leu40, Ile70, Val73, Leu75, and Pro77
have substantial effects on ALK4-trunc dominant negative activity
